;一架从韩国飞往新加坡的酷航飞机被发现缺少左鼻周一早上，它在预定的停留时间降落在台北。

;

;酷航表示，TR897 航班在桃园国际机场降落时检测到技术故障。

;

;“该航班原本是原定于凌晨 1 点 30 分从台北飞往新加坡的航班随后被取消，”它补充说。

;

;据台湾焦点报道，机上有 300 多名乘客。

;

;需要空姐新加坡-英国航班遭遇“恶劣”湍流后接受手术

;

;台湾媒体报道称，在飞机下降前，传感器检测到轮胎压力异常，导致飞机在凌晨 12 点 06 分着陆时左侧前轮脱落。;

; p>;

;“当飞机着陆时，左轮胎和前起落架上的金属轮辋被剪掉，只留下右前轮胎来保持飞机直立和移动，”台湾新闻报道。

;

;Focus Taiwan 也报道桃园国际机场称，跑道或滑行道上没有车轮的迹象。

;

;前轮协助飞机在起飞和降落时控制方向，“以据航空安全门户网站 SKYbrary 报道，允许飞机在地面上机动”。

;

;台湾交通运输部长王国才告诉媒体，该事件将由民航局和相关部门进行调查

;

;“已为我们的乘客安排了酒店住宿和航班退款（如适用）。酷航将在新加坡转机航班上为客户提供帮助，”酷航表示。

;

;它补充说，已为其余乘客安排了 TR897D 恢复航班，于周一晚上 8 点 45 分从台北飞往新加坡。

;

;新加坡航空公司的财富正在飙升。香港的国泰航空呢？

;

;根据樟宜机场的网站，恢复航班于周二凌晨 1 点 35 分降落在新加坡。

;

;“酷航对造成的中断和不便深表歉意。我们的客户和机组人员的安全是我们的首要任务，我们将继续在必要时为受影响的客户提供帮助，”Scoot 说。

;中国对澳大利亚矿产行业的投资必须“从战略上”考虑，因为两国之间存在直接竞争资源部长马德琳·金 (Madeleine King) 说，她在锂精炼领域的发展。

;

;澳大利亚期待已久的关键矿产战略发布后，她在接受采访时发表了上述评论，该战略包括吸引 5 亿澳元（3.4 亿美元）的目标为对能源转型至关重要的项目提供大量资金。

;

;该战略呼吁“志同道合的合作伙伴”进行外国投资，以促进国内锂和钴等电池金属的开采和精炼。当被问及是否欢迎中国的参与时，金说澳大利亚必须采取战略方针。

;

;“我们在这里与中国竞争，”她说。 “我们还想成为氢氧化锂的生产商。我们想要在该领域实现我们的雄心是很自然的。”

;

;澳大利亚是世界上最大的锂生产国，一半以上的金属用于电动汽车、智能手机和电网规模的电池，政府预测产量到 2028 年将翻一番。但其中绝大部分仍运往中国，中国在电池级化学品的下游加工中占主导地位。

;

;堪培拉和华盛顿正努力通过外交和经济合作合作伙伴建立他们的关键矿产工业，打破中国在某些领域的垄断，这些领域生产对国防、航空航天和绿色经济领域的高科技制造至关重要的材料。

;

;中国公司已经在中国投资氢氧化锂精炼厂金说，西澳大利亚和未来的决定将由外国投资审查委员会做出。但她说，北京花了 30 年时间投资和建设其关键矿产行业，而澳大利亚“落后于游戏”，需要迎头赶上。

;

;澳大利亚以国家利益为由阻止中国投资稀土公司< /h3>;

;到 2040 年，澳大利亚的国内生产总值可能会增长 1330 亿澳元（909 亿美元），如果在关键矿产方面建立更多的下游加工能力并确保更大的贸易和投资份额，则可能会创造超过 260,000 个就业岗位，根据战略。

;

;但是，堪培拉的更多投资目标远低于美国根据《降低通货膨胀法案》将用于提振其关键矿业的数十亿美元。金说，虽然她理解需要更多资金的呼声，但 5 亿澳元“不容小觑”。

;

;“我们不能超过美国，”她说。 “它对降低通货膨胀法案的投资确实很重要，但我们没有那么大的经济体来花那么多钱。”

;中国大陆从周二开始恢复从台湾进口糖苹果，结束了一项禁令自 2021 年以来一直到位并搁置了政治摩擦。

;

;这是在周末与大陆官员和台湾县县长以及台湾反对党国民党副主席会面之后，企业在消息人士告诉邮报，台湾推动进一步解除北京实施的进口禁令。

;

;驻北京的国务院台湾事务办公室证实，在中国大陆切断甜食进口后，该禁令已解除2021 年 9 月，也被称为 atemoya 或释迦的水果。

;

;中国大陆官员此前指出了生物安全担忧和可能的害虫，而台湾则表示这些说法缺乏“科学证据”。

;

;台湾对中国游客的禁令在中断 3 年后将“大幅”放宽

;

;国民党副主席夏安东和台东县长饶庆龄表达了“强烈愿望”国台办发言人朱凤莲表示，要在周末会议期间恢复贸易。

;

;朱补充说，他们还“组织”农民提高质量以确保安全，而水果必须来自“注册”果园和包装商。

;

;过去两年，中国大陆官员一直在削减台湾水果和海鲜的进口，追踪两岸关系的螺旋式下降。

;

;北京的观点自治的台湾是一个分裂的领土，必须在必要时通过武力重新统一。继美国前众议院议长南希佩洛西 8 月访问台湾后，中国大陆禁止进口部分台湾产品。

;

;2021 年菠萝和莲雾被禁止进口，柑橘类水果也于 8 月被禁止进口，尽管北京在 1 月份取消了对金门高粱酒的禁令。

;

;台东县的数据显示，位于台湾东南部的台东县种植了 2,800 公顷（6,919 英亩）的糖苹果。

;< p>;数据显示，2021 年 12 月至 2020 年 4 月期间，全球共出口了 4,355 吨糖苹果。

;

;每年，糖苹果占台东经济的 20% 至 30%。

;

;台东县县长饶周末在第 15 届海峡论坛上向中国大陆官员询问恢复进口水果的问题，包括糖苹果和菠萝，曾在厦门参加该活动的台湾前立法委员乔安娜·雷 (Joanna Lei) 说。

;

; “她得到了承诺，说他们能够解决这个问题，”雷说，她也是台湾中华 21 世纪智库的首席执行官。

;

;总的来说，她说，大多数与会者论坛“希望继续合作”。

;

;该县发言人说，在过去两年中，该县政府与当地一所大学合作，以“提高”糖苹果的安全性，使其符合大陆标准。

;

;海峡论坛旨在促进与台湾更深层次的经济融合，约 5,000 人将参加周六在厦门开幕的第 15 届论坛。

;

;习近平主席派遣官方媒体《中国日报》在周六致论坛的一封信中表示，北京将“促进海峡两岸的经济和文化交流”。

;

;“现在任何形式的对话都非常重要，因为我们”台北中国文化大学社会科学系主任赵建民说。

;

;“人们现在认识到，政治家无法打开一个渠道。这种人与人之间的对话表明大陆想表明事情可以这样解决。”

;中国最高外交官王毅此前曾敦促美国重新调整其印太战略如果华盛顿希望在具有重要战略意义的地区与北京建立健康的互动关系，那么今年的亚太经合组织领导人峰会就将举行。

;

;在周一与美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯的备受期待的会谈中，王表示，该战略是“本质上是企图在亚太地区引入大国竞争，制造阵营之间的对抗”。

;

;美国将于 11 月主办亚太经合组织领导人论坛，让华盛顿王说，这是“重新考虑和重新调整”印太战略的重要机会。

;

;在北京举行的大约三个小时的会议中，王指责华盛顿“改变了和平与稳定的现状”亚太地区 [和] 破坏亚太国家作为邻国的和谐。

;

;美国的政策也在“扭曲该地区的生产和供应链，削弱以东盟为中心的区域合作框架” ，根据中国外交部周一晚间发布的一份简报，王说。

;

;但作为习近平主席最高级外交政策顾问的王在呼吁在该地区开展双边合作时语气亲切，由于地理位置靠近中国，北京认为这对其战略利益至关重要。

;

;即使没有突破，布林肯访华也可能取得成功：分析人士

;

;“中国愿意探索与美国在亚太地区积极互动的方式，希望美国发挥东道主作用，与中方共同努力，推动亚太合作回到正确方向。”他说。

;

;自 2017 年时任总统唐纳德·特朗普在越南举行的亚太经合组织峰会上宣布该战略以来，该战略一直是美国外交政策的支柱。它旨在促进横跨美国西海岸到印度西海岸的地区的经济和安全合作。

;

;拜登政府保留并制定了该战略，作为其加强与其他国家伙伴关系的努力的一部分有意识的国家对抗中国在该地区不断扩大的影响力。

;

;北京一直拒绝印太概念，将其视为旨在遏制中国地区和全球野心的遏制战略，以及中国的企图华盛顿包围中国。

;

;尽管拜登政府坚称其无意遏制中国，但中国官员一再表示反对这一战略，他们担心这会损害北京的利益，尤其是在南中国海以及台湾海峡——被认为是两个大国之间最有可能的导火索。

;

;华盛顿最高外交官布林肯也是五年来访问中国的最高级别的美国官员。他为期两天的北京之行被广泛认为是双方稳定关系的最新尝试，许多人担心这种关系可能会陷入战争。

;

;Hong Kong is the most expensive city for workers living overseas according to a recent survey by a global consulting firm, with Singapore coming in at second place.

;

;Consultancy firm Mercer released the results of its cost of living survey on Tuesday, which found the city had topped its list for a second year in a row, while Singapore climbed six places. Swiss cities Zurich, Geneva and Basel rounded out the other top places in third, fourth, and fifth, respectively.

;

;Tracey Ma, the firm's Regional Mobility Leader for Asia Pacific, attributed Singapore's rise mainly to its strong currency position as well as high inflation caused by supply chain disruptions and rising fuel costs.

;

;Hong Kong is world's most expensive city for driving, global index shows

;

;“Across the region, we have experienced high inflation in a majority of the key markets,” Ma said.

;

;The results differed slightly from another cost of living survey for expatriates by human capital firm ECA International earlier this month, which placed Hong Kong in second behind the United States' New York . Singapore had also climbed the ranks by eight places to land in fifth.

;

;Housing costs were a major factor in ECA's rankings, with the report attributing New York's skyrocketing rent prices to people returning after the pandemic, while Singapore's accommodation supply was unable to keep up with demand. According to ECA, housing prices in Hong Kong dropped, which experts have blamed on a slowing population and rising interest rates for mortgages.

;

;However, Mercer said mainland Chinese and Japanese cities bucked the trends of its survey. Most notably, capitals Beijing and Tokyo dropped out of their 2022 top 10 places to come in at 13th and 19th respectively.

;

;The three cities that lost the most ground in the rankings – Yokohama, Nagoya and Osaka were all Japanese, falling between 56 and 65 places from last year.

;

;Cities on the mainland also dropped in the rankings. While Shanghai retained its spot in 12th, Shenzhen fell seven places to 20th, while Guangzhou went from 18th to 36th and Qingdao from 22nd to 55th. Mercer explained Shanghai's performance was because of a shrinking housing market and declining demand in rental properties.

;

;“Almost all the cities in Mainland China and Japan have dropped their rankings,” Ma said.

;

;“The key reasons are relatively slower consumer demand, and their weaker currency position against the US dollar. Japan has also been experiencing low domestic consumption and that has affected its recovery from the pandemic.”

;

;'Life's better in prison': rising cost of living hits Hong Kong's poor hard

;

;Globally, Denmark's Copenhagen came in at 9th, while New York – at sixth place – topped the rankings for North America. Israel's Tel Aviv, in eighth, was the most expensive city in the Middle East.

;

;Mercer predicted that “aggressive national monetary policies and the tightening of global financial conditions” were likely to cause sluggish income growth and more unemployment in 2023.

;

;The firm said many employers across the world were reconsidering their priorities after months of remote work throughout the Covid-19 pandemic in terms of assessing work-life balance and thinking about the cities in which they chose to live.

;

;“Many employers are having to rethink how they manage a globally distributed workforce, especially for those that operate in tight labor markets,” the report said.

;The Hong Kong-traded shares of Chinese dual-listed companies have been closing the price gaps with their onshore peers, as distressed valuations and a pause in US interest rate increases boost the appeal of this tranche of stocks.

;

;Stocks of firms including the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and China Mobile trading in the city, also known as “H shares”, currently trade at a 27 per cent discount to their mainland China-traded yuan shares, the smallest gap between the two types of shares since February, according to a Hang Seng gauge tracking the price difference. China's tight capital controls limit the ability of Chinese investors to expatriate funds and restrict them to investing in A shares, boosting their share prices and valuations above those of H shares.

;

;The smaller divergence in the performance of the Hong Kong dollar-denominated H shares and the yuan-denominated A shares also mirrors the fact that the broader Hong Kong market has roared back to beat onshore shares after the US Federal Reserve refrained from raising interest rates this month following 10 straight increases. The easing of geopolitical tensions between Beijing and Washington following US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's visit to China is also a factor.

;

;The Hang Seng Index has climbed 7.5 per cent in June, outperforming the CSI 300 Index, which has gained 3.5 per cent. The 80-member Hong Kong gauge is also the cheapest among the world's major markets, with a multiple of 6.1 times estimated earnings for this year, according to Refinitiv data.

;

;“Looking from a six-month horizon, Hong Kong stocks have the potential of further recovery against the backdrop of an improvement in liquidity and China's supportive measures to revive growth,” said Kong Rong, an analyst at Tianfeng Securities. “All that will drive up the earnings expectations.”

;

;The AH premium index recently traded at 137.70 after falling to its lowest level since February 17 on Monday. A reading above 100 means that yuan shares are trading at a premium to underlying H shares, and vice versa. H shares have traded at a discount of 29 per cent on average to onshore stocks over the past year.

;

;Price gap for dual-listed stocks hits 5-month high amid SOE, AI euphoria

;

;Currently, 156 Chinese companies – from the country's biggest state-controlled companies to well-known private enterprises such as BYD and Great Wall Motor – have dual-listing status.

;

;Among these, China Merchants Bank is the only firm whose yuan shares are cheaper than its Hong Kong-traded stock with a 1.3 per cent discount, according to data provider Shanghai DZH. Holly Futures and automobile parts maker Zhejiang Shibao, meanwhile, can boast of the biggest premiums, with their yuan shares at least six times as expensive as their H shares, the data shows.

;

;Some investors have seen value emerge from the battered valuations of H shares, and even the entire Hong Kong market.

;

;China stimulus: too little, too late to jump-start Hong Kong's stock market?

;

;“Hong Kong stocks, in general, are trading below their fundamental worth, making them attractively priced,” said South Ocean Management, a Hong Kong-based money manager.

;

;“The recent market conditions have created an environment where values in Hong Kong are at their lowest since the great financial recession [of 2008].

;

;“We believe that any easing of geopolitical tensions or potential stimulus measures from Beijing could significantly boost market sentiment.”
